title: S&P 500: A Smarter Way To Buy Expensive Equities
text: Equities have had a strong start to the year, but earnings season is underway and it’s not looking good.

title: Downside risk to oil demand “has reduced” but price upside is limited: Analyst
text: The U.S.-China trade dispute reduced the downside risk to the oil demand outlook for this year “at least for now,” said Sushant Gupta, research director at Wood Mackenzie.

title: Asia shares feel a chill as China virus risks mount
text: Asian shares took a sudden turn for the worse on Tuesday as mounting concerns about a new strain of coronavirus in China sent a ripple of risk aversion through markets.

title: Oil prices ease as supply risk concerns fade
text: Oil prices eased on Tuesday as investors appeared to shrug off earlier supply concerns following a force majeure declared by Libya on two major oilfields amid a military blockade.

title: Dow Jones Industrials Setting Up for a 30,000 Market Top?
text: A couple weeks back, I took a look at the Dow Jones Industrial Average and shared my thoughts on how the rest of January may play out. Is this a final rally of a soon-to-be trading top?

title: Why Goldman Sachs's Currie Is Bullish on Commodities in 2020
text: Jeff Currie, global head of commodities research at Goldman Sachs, discusses the potential for carbon capture technologies, oil prices and his outlook for metals.

title: Asia shares hold steady, BOJ and Trump awaited
text: Asian shares got off to a cautious start on Tuesday lacking any lead from Wall Street and after the IMF shaved its outlook for world growth this year, though it did offer a brighter view on China.

title: Building An Income Portfolio With A Sector Risk Ladder
text: We generalize the bond ladder concept into a risk ladder which can be helpful in identifying attractive sectors and fund structure combinations for various levels of historic price risk.

title: Are Earnings Reports Just OK, or Better than Expected?

title: Warren Buffett: There Is a Big Difference Between a Great Stock and a Great Industry

title: IMF Trims Global Economic Outlook But Tones Down Risk Warnings
text: Gita Gopinath, chief economist at the International Monetary Fund, discusses her prediction that the world economy will strengthen in 2020, albeit at a slightly slower pace than previously anticipated amid threats related to trade and tensions in the Middle East.

title: Global Political Risk is Forecast to Fall in 2020
text: Despite a recent spike, GeoQuant’s 2020 Year Ahead outlook forecasts that  Global Political Risk will actually decline through the first half of 2020, re-accelerating in the second half but remaining subdued relative to the tumultuous period beginning in 2016.

title: Four Things The Fed Is Monitoring For Its Next Move On Rates
text: As we enter 2020, the Fed perceives it outlook for interest rates to be broadly neutral. In contrast financial markets imply a cut maybe coming in 2020.

title: Where's The 'Hot Hand'
text: Based on the performance of a handful of the most widely tracked MSCI factor indexes, 2019 was a difficult year for long-only factor investing, and even trickier for factor momentum.

title: IMF cuts global growth forecasts as India falters, says bottom may be near
text: The International Monetary Fund on Monday trimmed back its 2020 global growth forecasts due to sharper-than-expected slowdowns in India and other emerging markets but said a U.S.-China trade deal was another sign that trade and manufacturing activity may soon bottom out.

title: IMF says the outlook for the global economy 'remains sluggish' as it cuts growth forecasts
text: The IMF has become less optimistic about global growth, warning that the outlook remains sluggish and there are no clear signs of a turning point.

title: The recession in global car sales has gotten worse — and it's likely to continue
text: The global auto industry plunged deeper into recession in 2019, with sales dropping more than 4% as carmakers struggled to find buyers in China and India. The pain is likely to continue this year.

title: Feel good factor keeps world stocks near record highs, oil jumps
text: World stocks held near record highs on Monday as generally better data and earnings bolstered sentiment, while oil prices hit their highest in over a week after two large crude production bases in Libya began shutting down following a blockade.

title: Oil rises to more than a week high after Libyan outage
text: Oil prices rose to their highest in more than week on Monday after two large crude production bases in Libya began shutting down amid a military blockade, setting the stage for crude flows from the OPEC member to be cut to a trickle.

title: There's a 50% chance the US-China 'phase one' deal could fall apart in one year

title: Midstream Phase Won
text: Midstream gains kept rolling for a sixth straight week, again riding a strong broad equity market higher, and defying weakness in upstream energy stocks.

title: Market Continues 'Euphoric' Advance As 3500 Becomes Next Target
text: With the Federal Reserve continuing to pump liquidity into the market currently, we are raising our 2020 estimate for the S&P to 3500 as "the mania" goes mainstream.
